journals.notes:
> I haven’t found yet what could make it different from the others.

The fireteam command menu is hardcoded (in cgame), while the other menus use the script system (.menu files).

Actually now I came to notice that there is this event handler in cg_newDraw. So yeah, you are absolutely correct. So at this point the only question is that to which direction this case should be heading? Should eveyrhting be hardcoded or rather not?

-*S

Hardcoding provides greater flexibility (which the fireteam menu make use of), but doing so is indeed lot of work. Using menu file is much simpler and faster, but we can't exactly do everything we want. Is it worth hardcoding all the menu to fix that little cursor issue? Absolutely not.

That is a valid point. This is such a minor issue so it might not be worth it. But still in the end of the day, a fixable bug is always fixable. ;)

But we can let this be as it is... for now.

-*S
